title: India's growth story is 'very mixed' right now; a rate cut in August is unlikely: Economist
text: Sakshi Gupta, Principal Economist at HDFC Bank, says that while government spending and support for infrastructure and capital goods remain strong, consumption growth in India is lagging, evident in high-frequency indicators like passenger vehicle sales, which have been weak. On employment, she adds that a meaningful pickup is still awaited.

title: Australian Inflation Continued to Cool in Second Quarter
text: Inflation continued to ease in the second quarter, raising bets that the Australian central bank will deliver a rate cut next month.

title: Reasons To Stay Bullish
text: Consumer confidence and Q2 GDP data point to continued economic resilience, supporting the case for further market growth in the near term. Upcoming earnings from Mag7 companies are likely to beat expectations, fueled by robust economic conditions.

title: Australia's second-quarter inflation drops to lowest since March 2021, supporting case for rate cut
text: Australia's second-quarter inflation drops to lowest since March 2021, supporting case for rate cut

title: Possible dissents this week by Christopher Waller and Michelle Bowman would mark the first time in three decades that more than one Federal Reserve governor dissented at a policy meeting
text: Possible dissents by Christopher Waller and Michelle Bowman would mark the first time in three decades that more than one Fed governor dissented at a policy meeting.

title: Singapore's Central Bank Leaves Monetary Policy Untouched As Tariffs Loom
text: Singapore's central bank has kept its policy band unchanged after easing policy in its last two meetings, as the city-state continues to face risks from looming U.S. tariffs.

title: Jim Cramer on if UPS and other earnings signal a broader slowdown ahead
text: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer talks signs cracks could be forming in the economy.

title: Market is becoming divorced from some real problems that should have been obvious, says Jim Cramer
text: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer talks signs cracks could be forming in the economy.

title: 'Fast Money' traders on how they are navigating mixed market signals
text: The 'Fast Money' traders talk how they are navigating mixed market signals.

title: Stock Market Dips Ahead Of Fed, Inflation Data, Jobs Report; Earnings Winners Include Celestica, Corning, Rambus
text: The Nasdaq and S&P 500 reversed lower in the stock market, but losses were mild and there was no shortage of big earnings winners.

title: Market is priced to perfection, companies expected to have stellar guidance: Evans May Wealth's May
text: Brooke May, Evans May Wealth managing partner, joins 'Closing Bell Overtime' to talk what is still ahead this week that could cause big swings in the market.

title: Senator Warren on Fed Rates, Housing Act and Epstein Case
text: Senator Elizabeth Warren, a Massachusetts Democrat, says President Donald Trump's tariffs are to blame for higher interest rates. Speaking on "Balance of Power," Senator Warren also comments on the Senate's "ROAD to Housing Act" and convicted sex offender and Jeffrey Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell's scheduled testimony before a congressional committee's investigators next month.

title: Bessent to American businesses: 'Not the end of the world' if April 2 tariffs kick in
text: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed possible disruptions to American businesses from President Donald Trump's tariffs. Businesses in the U.S. are bracing for Trump's tariffs to take effect, following months of uncertainty.

title: Great opportunity to reallocate to safe side of markets, says Treasury Partners' Richard Saperstein
text: Richard Saperstein, Treasury Partners CIO, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the latest news affecting markets, who will be paying the tariffs and much more.

title: AI expansion benefits need to come stocks outside of the megacaps, says Bespoke's Paul Hickey
text: Bespoke's Paul Hickey joins 'Closing Bell: Overtime' to discuss the upcoming quarterly earnings results.

title: Why the man behind ‘The Hater's Guide to the AI Bubble' thinks Wall Street's hottest trade will go bust
text: Since OpenAI launched ChatGPT in November 2022, generative artificial-intelligence chatbots have attracted millions of users and provoked plenty of excitement. But some skeptics are asking: If this technology is destined to be as successful as its evangelists claim, why isn't it generating any profits?

title: Markets Lose Steam Ahead of Fed Meeting | Closing Bell
text: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. -------- More on Bloomberg Television and Markets Like this video?

title: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell more than 200 points, with investors considering a possible tariff extension for China and a fresh batch of corporate earnings
text: Earnings reports showed signs of tariff-induced stress.

title: Bessent warns China on Russian oil purchases that could bring 100% tariffs
text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Tuesday said he warned Chinese officials that continued purchases of sanctioned Russian oil would lead to big tariffs due to legislation in Congress, but was told that Beijing would protect its energy sovereignty.

title: Sycamore's Mark Okada: Labor data is starting to concern me
text: Mark Okada, Sycamore Tree Capital co-founder and CEO, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss if the market's under appreciating trade talks, the names that are exposed to China tariffs and much more.
